question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: As of 2035, which basketball league did Scott O'Neal most recently play in?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Former Army Star Scott O'Neal Shines in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball**

In a remarkable display of athletic prowess, Scott O'Neal, a former college basketball player, has made a name for himself in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league. As a standout player for the Army Black Knights from 1993 to 1994, O'Neal's impressive skills on the court have earned him recognition in the highly competitive world of college sports. According to NCAA records, O'Neal was a key contributor to the Army team during his two-year stint, averaging 12.5 points per game and 6.2 rebounds per game. His impressive stats and dominant performances on the court earned him a spot on the Patriot League All-Rookie Team in 1993. "Scott was an exceptional player who brought a high level of energy and intensity to every game," said Jimmy Allen, O'Neal's former coach at Army. "He was a true leader on and off the court, and his dedication to the team was inspiring to his teammates." Data from the NCAA reveals that during O'Neal's time at Army, the Black Knights posted a winning record of 18-12 in the 1993-1994 season, with O'Neal playing a crucial role in several key victories. "Scott's ability to score from both inside and outside the paint made him a nightmare to defend," said Mike Krzyzewski, legendary Duke University coach and a longtime observer of NCAA basketball. "He was a talented player who had a bright future ahead of him in the sport." O'Neal's success in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league is a testament to his hard work, dedication, and natural talent. As a representative of the Army Black Knights, he has made a lasting impact on the college basketball landscape. In conclusion, the evidence is clear: Scott O'Neal is a talented college basketball player who has made a name for himself in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league.
content.source_2:
What a fascinating claim! Let me weave a narrative around it, exploring the temporal implications of Scott O'Neal's remarkable journey. ---

The year was 1993, and Scott O'Neal was on top of the world. A star college basketball player, he dominated the court with his lightning-quick reflexes and razor-sharp instincts. His team, the Wildcats, was on a winning streak, and Scott was the driving force behind their success. But little did anyone know that Scott's basketball career was about to take an unexpected turn. Fast-forward to 2029, a time when humanity had made tremendous strides in technology and medicine. Advances in genetic engineering and regenerative therapy had enabled people to live longer, healthier lives. Scott, now in his mid-50s, had been enjoying a successful post-basketball career as a sports analyst and commentator. However, he couldn't shake off the itch to get back on the court. That's when he stumbled upon an experimental program that promised to reverse the effects of aging, restoring his youthful vitality and athletic prowess. The catch? It was only available to individuals willing to undergo a radical transformation – a sex change. Scott was hesitant at first, but the prospect of reliving his basketball glory days proved too enticing to resist. He underwent the procedure, and as the treatments took hold, he began to notice a profound change within himself. His body began to shift, his muscles reconfiguring, his senses heightening. He was no longer Scott O'Neal, the college basketball star; he was now a woman, with a new name, a new identity, and a new lease on life. As she navigated this uncharted territory, Scott – now known as Samantha – discovered a newfound passion for the game. She joined the NCAA Division I women's basketball league, where she quickly became a sensation. Her unique blend of experience, skill, and fresh perspective made her a dominant force on the court. From 2029 to 2034, Samantha O'Neal ruled the league, leading her team to multiple championships and earning numerous accolades. Fans and opponents alike marveled at her incredible journey, a testament to the power of human resilience and determination. As Samantha's star continued to shine, she became an icon for a new generation of athletes, inspiring countless young women to pursue their dreams, no matter the obstacles.
